chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
Y: Type
p: X -> Prop
q: Y -> Prop

Goal:
p ⪯ q -> enumerable__T X -> discrete Y -> enumerable q -> enumerable p

Premises:
enumerable__T = fun X : Type => exists f : nat -> option X, enumerator__T f X : Type -> Prop Arguments enumerable__T _%type_scope
discrete = fun X : Type => decidable (fun '(x, y) => x = y) : Type -> Prop Arguments discrete _%type_scope
enumerable = fun (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) => exists f : nat -> option X, enumerator f P : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments enumerable {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
enumerable_conj : forall (X : Type) (p q : X -> Prop), discrete X -> enumerable p -> enumerable q -> enumerable (fun x : X => p x /\ q x)
ListEnumerabilityFacts.enumerable_conj : forall (X : Type) (p q : X -> Prop), discrete X -> enumerable p -> enumerable q -> enumerable (fun x : X => p x /\ q x)
red_comp : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (q : Y -> Prop), p ⪯ q -> (fun x : X => ~ p x) ⪯ (fun y : Y => ~ q y)
dec_red : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (q : Y -> Prop), p ⪯ q -> decidable q -> decidable p
enumerable_disj : forall (X : Type) (p q : X -> Prop), enumerable p -> enumerable q -> enumerable (fun x : X => p x \/ q x)
VectorDef.nth_order : VectorDef.t ?A ?n -> forall p0 : nat, p0 < ?n -> ?A where ?A : [X : Type Y : Type p : X -> Prop q : Y -> Prop |- Type] ?n : [X : Type Y : Type p : X -> Prop q : Y -> Prop |- nat]
ListEnumerabilityFacts.projection' : forall (X Y : Type) (p : X * Y -> Prop), enumerable p -> enumerable (fun y : Y => exists x : X, p (x, y))
projection' : forall (X Y : Type) (p : X * Y -> Prop), enumerable p -> enumerable (fun y : Y => exists x : X, p (x, y))
projection : forall (X Y : Type) (p : X * Y -> Prop), enumerable p -> enumerable (fun x : X => exists y : Y, p (x, y))
ListEnumerabilityFacts.projection : forall (X Y : Type) (p : X * Y -> Prop), enumerable p -> enumerable (fun x : X => exists y : Y, p (x, y))
Fin.caseS' : forall (p0 : Fin.t (S ?n)) (P : Fin.t (S ?n) -> Type), P Fin.F1 -> (forall p1 : Fin.t ?n, P (Fin.FS p1)) -> P p0 where ?n : [X : Type Y : Type p : X -> Prop q : Y -> Prop |- nat]
cumul_In : forall (L : nat -> list ?X) (x : ?X) (n : nat), x el L n -> x el cumul L (S n) where ?X : [X : Type Y : Type p : X -> Prop q : Y -> Prop |- Type]
discrete_sum : forall X Y : Type, discrete X -> discrete Y -> discrete (X + Y)
discrete_prod : forall X Y : Type, discrete X -> discrete Y -> discrete (X * Y)
In_cumul : forall (L : nat -> list ?X) (x : ?X) (n : nat), x el cumul L n -> exists n0 : nat, x el L n0 where ?X : [X : Type Y : Type p : X -> Prop q : Y -> Prop |- Type]
dec_count_enum' : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), decidable p -> enumerable__T X -> enumerable (fun x : X => ~ p x)
reduces_transitive : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (Q : Y -> Prop) (Z : Type) (R : Z -> Prop), P ⪯ Q -> Q ⪯ R -> P ⪯ R
VectorDef.caseS : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (S n) -> Type, (forall (h : ?A) (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t ?A n), P n (VectorDef.cons ?A h n t)) -> forall (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A (S n)), P n v where ?A : [X : Type Y : Type p : X -> Prop q : Y -> Prop |- Type]
dec_count_enum = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (H : decidable p) => let H0 : semi_decidable p := SemiDecidabilityFacts.decidable_semi_decidable H in fun H1 : enumerable__T X => semi_decidable_enumerable H1 H0 : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), decidable p -> enumerable__T X -> enumerable p Arguments dec_count_enum {X}%type_scope {p}%function_scope
reduces = fun (X Y : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Q : Y -> Prop) => exists f : X -> Y, reduction f P Q : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Prop) -> (Y -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments reduces {X Y}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
reduction = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (P : X -> Prop) (Q : Y -> Prop) => forall x : X, P x < -> Q (f x) : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> (X -> Prop) -> (Y -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments reduction {X Y}%type_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
sum_eq_dec : forall X Y : Type, eq_dec X -> eq_dec Y -> eq_dec X + Y
prod_eq_dec : forall X Y : Type, eq_dec X -> eq_dec Y -> eq_dec X * Y
reduces_dependent : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (Q : Y -> Prop), P ⪯ Q < -> inhabited (forall x : X, {y : Y | P x <-> Q y})
BinNat.N.add_lt_mono : forall n m p q : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.lt n m -> BinNat.N.lt p q -> BinNat.N.lt (BinNat.N.add n p) (BinNat.N.add m q)
ListEnumerabilityFacts.enumerable_enum = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) => conj (fun H : enumerable p => enumerable_list_enumerable H) (fun H : list_enumerable p => list_enumerable_enumerable H) : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), enumerable p < -> list_enumerable p Arguments ListEnumerabilityFacts.enumerable_enum {X}%type_scope {p}%function_scope
enumerable_enum = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) => conj enumerable_list_enumerable list_enumerable_enumerable : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), enumerable p < -> list_enumerable p Arguments enumerable_enum {X}%type_scope {p}%function_scope
discrete_list : forall X : Type, discrete X -> discrete (list X)
discrete_option : forall X : Type, discrete X -> discrete (option X)
BinNatDef.N.pow = fun n p : BinNums.N => match p with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH | BinNums.Npos p0 => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.pow q p0) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.pow (_ _)%N_scope
